member.name: M:LoneWolf.Common.Image.CommonImage.CropAndResize(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32,LoneWolf.Common.Image.CropAndResizeOptions)
member.summary:
Crops and resizes an image according to the dimensions specified.
If the underlying System.Drawing.Image object fails the call to IsCroppable, then the cropped image is not gauranteed to be compatible with the format of the original image. For instance, some GIF files cannot be cropped in their raw state. This method will return a cropped image with a PixelFormat of Format32bppArgb.
If the resizedWidth and resizedHeight dimensions are bigger than the width and height of the cropping rectangle, then the image returned will be the same dimensions as the cropping rectangle. In other words, the image will not be blown up to fit the specified resized dimensions.
The width and height parameters are passed by reference. So after this function call, their values will be changed to the actual values of the width and height of the rectangle used for cropping. These can change if the cropping rectangle passed in is not the exact same ratio as the the ratio specified by resizedWidth and resizedHeight. The cropping rectangle will be adjusted to be the same ratio.
member.param: The left coordinate on the image to use for the crop.
The top coordinate on the image to use for the crop.
The width of the cropping rectangle. Pass in 0 to use the entire image width.
The height of the cropping rectangle. Pass in 0 to use the entire image height.
The width of the resized image. Pass in 0 to use the width of the cropping rectangle.
The height of the resized image. Pass in 0 to use the height of the cropping rectangle.
The options for the crop and resize process.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Image object that represents the cropped image.

member.name: F:LoneWolf.Common.Image.HorizontalAdjustment.MoveBottom
member.summary: Adjusts the cropping rectangle to be the same ratio passed in but first moves the bottom coordinate down so that the cropping rectangle is higher than the passed in rectangle. If the calculated bottom is greater than the height of the image, then the height of the image is used and the bit for Center, Left or Right is checked for how to handle the horizontal movement.
